ai-ud2.9:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-ud2.9:1.3_0: Now at that time Visākhā was caught up in some business with King Pasenadi.
ai-ud2.9:1.4_0: But the king’s settlement did not meet her expectations.
ai-ud2.9:2.1_0: Then, in the middle of the day, she went to the Buddha.
ai-ud2.9:2.3_0: “So, Visākhā, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”
ai-ud2.9:2.4_0: “Sir, I am caught up in some business with King Pasenadi.
ai-ud2.9:2.5_0: But the king’s settlement did not meet my expectations.”
ai-ud2.9:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.9:4.2_0: all under one’s own authority is pleasing;
ai-ud2.9:4.3_0: what’s shared is stressful for both parties,
ai-ud2.9:4.4_0: for bonds are hard to escape.”
